wouldn't it be more safer to use the alternate iso instead?
i use ddclient to update my dyndns.org address, it's worked for me for years :)
how do you try another country's archive server?
edit /etc/apt/sources.list, you will have something like us.archive.ubuntu.com which is the US server, you can change that to de for the German server, nl for the Dutch server, etc.
you don't even need an ftp server, openssh provides sftp anyway
plus it has the calendar thing that verus_ wants.
but upgrading it later is more difficult because you are not using ubuntu packaging
